Package org.sd.cio.mapreduce

Interface Summary
FlushAction.AddStrategy<K,V,A> Do the work of operating on data while filling for a flush.
FlushActionFactory<K,V,A> Factory class for MapperAction instances to be used by a Mapper.
OutputFinalizer<C> Interface for finalizing output based on context.
RecordFileStrategy<K,V> Interface for managing record files used with flush actions.
 

Class Summary
AbstractFlushActionFactory<K,V,A> Abstract FlushActionFactory base class.
CombinedMapReduce<K extends Comparable<K>,V,A,R> Utility to map arbitrary input, then reduce until done.
CommonFlushActionFactory<K,V,A> A common base for a FlushActionFactory that generates FlushAction instances for Mappers or Reducers.
DirectFlushAction<K,V,A> A flush strategy that directly writes each added record.
DirWalker Base class for walking over directories and files (optionally) in a governable thread, applying a fileOperation to each selected file and/or directory.
FlushAction<K,V,A> Strategy to flush generated data out to structured files.
MapContainer<K,V> A container holding an ordered map whose entries are written to a file.
Mapper<K,V,A,R> Map process definition utility.
MapperPair<K,V,A> Container for a key/value pair that also retains the pair's action key.
MapReduceBase<K,V,A,R> Base map and reduce process definition utility.
PublishableMapContainer<K extends Publishable,V extends Publishable> A container holding an ordered map whose entries are written as binary to a file.
Reducer<K,V,A,R> Reduce process definition utility.
RepeatingReducer<K,V,A,R> A reducer that repeats execution until done.
ResourceHelper Utility methods for building resources.
SimpleFlushAction<K,V,A> A flush strategy that uses a MapContainer for flushing a constant number of records.
SimpleMapReduce<K extends Comparable<K>,V,A,R> Simple base implementation of CombinedMapReduce.
SimpleTextRecordFileStrategy<K,V> A TextRecordFileStrategy that uses a vertical bar delimiter and html escaping.
TextRecordFileStrategy<K,V> A record file strategy for text records, one delimited record per line.
